info.title: Adobe PDF Services
info.description: Adobe PDF Services API brings a set of powerful cloud-based APIs to integrate multi-step document workflows into any application. Use document generation to create custom PDF documents from Word templates and JSON data. Extract text, tables and images from PDFs in a structured JSON to enable downstream solutions. Convert to PDF, export PDF to other formats, apply OCR, compress, linearize or protect PDFs, and also edit PDFs with tools like merge or split. Auto-tag PDFs for better Accessibility.

post.description: Convert an Excel file to PDF format. Only files with .xls or .xlsx extension are supported.

parameters.name: inputFileName
parameters.description: The name of the source file with extension.

parameters.name: outputFileName
parameters.description: The name of the converted PDF file. If it is not provided, source file name with .pdf extension will be used.

parameters.name: InputFile0
parameters.description: The content of the source file.

x-request-id.description: The Job Id to be used in JOB status operation.

post.description: Convert a file to PDF format. Only files with .doc, .docx, .ppt, .pptx, .xls, .xlsx, .bmp, .gif, .jpeg, .jpg, .png, .rtf, .tif, .tiff or .txt extension are supported.

parameters.description: The name of the source file with extension.

parameters.name: outputFileName
parameters.description: The name of the converted PDF file. If it is not provided, source file name with .pdf extension will be used.

post.description: Convert a Dynamic HTML file to PDF format. Since HTML/web pages typically contain external assets, the input file must be a zip file containing an index.html at the top level of the archive, as well as any dependencies such as images, css files, and so on. Only files with .zip extension are supported.

parameters.name: inputFileName
parameters.description: The name of the source file.

parameters.name: outputFileName
parameters.description: The name of the converted PDF file. If it is not provided, source file name with .pdf extension will be used.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for the output PDF document, A4 is the default size.

parameters.name: includeHeaderFooter
parameters.description: Header/Footer to be included in pdf or not

parameters.name: dataToMerge
parameters.description: The Json object containing key value pair to replaced in the output pdf.

parameters.name: InputFile0
parameters.description: The content of the source zip file containing index.html

x-request-id.description: The Job Id to be used in JOB status operation.

post.description: Convert a static HTML file to PDF format. parameters.description: The page size for the output PDF document, A4 is the default size.

parameters.name: InputFile0
parameters.description: The content of the source zip file containing index.html

post.description: Protect a PDF document from viewing. Only files with .pdf extension are supported.

parameters.name: outputFileName
parameters.description: The name of the protected PDF file. If it is not provided, source file name with .pdf extension will be used.

parameters.name: inputFileName
parameters.description: The name of the source file with extension.

parameters.name: userPassword
parameters.description: The password that will be set on the PDF document.

parameters.name: encryptionAlgorithm
parameters.description: The encryption algorithm that will be used to set the password.

parameters.name: contentEncryption
parameters.description: The encryption level that will be used to set the password.

parameters.name: InputFile0
parameters.description: The content of the source file.

x-request-id.description: The Job Id to be used in JOB status operation.

post.description: Protect a PDF document from copying, editing & printing. Only files with .pdf extension are supported.

parameters.name: outputFileName
parameters.description: The name of the protected PDF file. If it is not provided, source file name with .pdf extension will be used.

parameters.name: inputFileName
parameters.description: The name of the source file with extension.

parameters.name: ownerPassword
parameters.description: The password that will be required for access permissions.

parameters.name: encryptionAlgorithm
parameters.description: The encryption algorithm that will be used to set the password.

parameters.name: contentEncryption
parameters.description: The encryption level that will be used to set the password.

parameters.name: allowPrintLowQuality
parameters.description: Enables low quality printing of the PDF document.

parameters.name: allowPrintHighQuality
parameters.description: Enables high quality printing of the PDF document. If set to true, low quality printing would be allowed as well.

parameters.name: allowEditContent
parameters.description: Enables all the editing permissions in the PDF document except commenting and page extraction. If set to true, document assembly and fill & sign form fields editing would be allowed as well.

parameters.name: allowEditDocumentAssembly
parameters.description: Enables insertion, deletion and rotation of pages in a PDF document.

parameters.name: allowEditAnnotations
parameters.description: Enables additions of comments, digital signatures and filling in of forms in a PDF document.

parameters.x-ms-summary: Allow Fill & Sign Form Fields Editing?
parameters.name: allowEditFillAndSignFormFields
parameters.description: Enables filling in of forms, digital signature and creation of template pages in a PDF document.

parameters.name: allowCopyContent
parameters.description: Enables copying of content from the PDF document.

parameters.name: InputFile0
parameters.description: The content of the source file.

x-request-id.description: The Job Id to be used in JOB status operation.

parameters.name: contentEncryption

parameters.name: allowPrintLowQuality

parameters.description: Enables all the editing permissions in the PDF document except commenting and page extraction. If set to true, document assembly and fill & sign form fields editing would be allowed as well.

parameters.name: allowEditDocumentAssembly
parameters.description: Enables insertion, deletion and rotation of pages in a PDF document.

parameters.name: allowEditAnnotations
parameters.description: Enables additions of comments, digital signatures and filling in of forms in a PDF document.

parameters.x-ms-summary: Allow Fill & Sign Form Fields Editing?

post.description: Replaces merge fields in a DOCX template document with specified JSON data. The keys in data object should be the same as names of merge fields in document. Template documents can be authored using Adobe Document Generation Word Add-in. Find the add-in and Word templates at: https://adobe.com/go/dcdocgen_home. Detailed documentation for the Document Generation API can be found at: https://adobe.com/go/dcdocgen_overview_doc

parameters.name: inputFileName
parameters.description: The name of the source template file with extension.

parameters.name: jsonStringForMerge
parameters.description: JSON data that should be applied to the template. Click Help icon to know how to use json for authoring template and generating document.

parameters.name: targetFormat
parameters.description: The output format in which file is to be generated. The default is PDF.

parameters.name: outputFileName
parameters.description: The file name of the output file. If it is not provided, source file name with targetFormat extension will be used.
JSON data with the fragments to be included in the document template. Provide a JSON object containing all the fragments. To learn more, see https://www.adobe.com/go/dcdocgen_fragments_support
parameters.name: fragments
InputFile0
parameters.description: The content of the source template file. Click Help icon to find more about sample templates.

x-request-id.description: The Job Id to be used in JOB status operation.

post.description: Add tags to PDF documents to make them more accessible. All tags from the input file will be removed, except for existing alt-text images, and a new tagged PDF file will be created as output. Accessibility tags, used by assistive technology such as screen readers, are required to make PDF files compliant. However, the output is not guaranteed to comply with accessibility standards such as WCAG and PDF/UA, as you may need to perform further downstream remediation to meet those standards.

parameters.name: inputFileName
parameters.description: The name of the input file with extension.

parameters.name: fileData
parameters.description: The content of the input file.
Generate Report in XLS Format

jsonObject.description: All the PDF Properties in JSON Format

page_count.description: Number of pages in PDF Document

linearized.description: Whether the PDF is linearized (T) or not (F)

tagged.description: Whether the PDF is tagged (T) or not (F)

certified.description: Whether the PDF is certified (T) or not (F)

xfa.description: Whether the PDF is an XFA form (T) or not (F)

portfolio.description: Whether the PDF is a portfolio (T) or not (F)

encrypted.description: Whether the PDF is encrypted (T) or not (F)

hasAcroForms.description: Whether the PDF has Acroforms (T) or not (F)

signed.description: Whether the PDF is signed (T) or not (F)

hasEmbeddedFiles.description: Whether the PDF has embedded files (T) or not (F)

fonts.description: Array with Font information for PDF

pages.description: Array of properties for each page in the PDF

onlyImages.description: Whether the page only has images (T) or not (F)

hasText.description: Whether the page has text (T) or not (F)

hasImages.description: Whether the page has images (T) or not (F)

empty.description: Whether the page is empty (T) or not (F)
